byline.original: By REED ABELSON and MARGOT SANGER-KATZ

abstract: The Upshot; Kaiser Family Foundation analysis examines individual health plans offered in 14 cities under Affordable Care Act and finds many insurers are asking for 2017 increases that double those in 2016; reporters Reed Abelson and Margot Sanger-Katz discuss trend, which raises concerns about affordability and fate of health care law.
lead_paragraph: A new study shows health plans are asking for rate increases twice as high as last year’s. Two health reporters discuss what it means for the future.

headline.main: Yes, Obamacare Premiums Are Going Up
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Premiums Are Rising, Not a Little

snippet: A new study shows health plans are asking for rate increases twice as high as last year’s. Two health reporters discuss what it means for the future.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
